comments:
After freshly starting up Eclipse, going to Window -> Preferences -> C/C++ ->
Editor -> Templates, Eclipse shows me an error message: 
"Unable to create the selected preference page. Reason: Plug-in
"org.eclipse.cdt.ui" was unable to instantiate class
"org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.preferences.CTemplatePreferencePage". Details: SAX
parser error: reference to undeclared entity: lt"
I close the error message, and the preferences dialog shows an empty page
instead of the code templates preferences. I close the preferences dialog with
"Ok" and open it again. It pops up showing the templates preferences, but with
no code templates at all. (In this stage I can import code templates. They show
up and can be used when typing code. But Eclipse forgets them, when bein g
closed and started again)
I close the preferences dialog with "Cancel" and get another error message saying: 
"An error has occured. See error log for more details."
This is the log:

Some version ingformation:
OS: Fedora Core 4 (FC4 i386)
JRE: Sun j2re-1.4.2_09-fcs
Eclipse: version 3.1.0 build ID l20050627-1435
CDT version 3.0.0 (release)

Try the -clean option for eclipse and see if that helps.

I also notice that you are using the gcj version of java as evidenced by:

  java.fullversion=GNU libgcj 4.0.0 20050519 (Red Hat 4.0.0-8)

Make sure Sun's version of java is first in your path.

Doug,
thrown away the gcj version of java and running now Sun's version.
The -clean option helps, but only if I give it with each start of Eclipse. 
Otherwise I'll get beaten up by error messages already while eclipse is 
starting. This isn't normal, right? ;-)

Nope, doesn't sound normal to me. I'm running Fedora Core 4 here with the Sun 
VM 1.5 and I'm don't see this happening. Given that the first error I am sure 
was due to the gcj VM, could you post the new errors you are getting.

Created an attachment (id=26891)
